title: Quad bike: Boy, 3, dies in accident at Deddick Valley in Victoria
text:
Supplied video obtained Tuesday, July 24, 2018 of Minister for Better Regulation Matt Kean, and farmer Tim Carroll, speaking about a new virtual reality training experience for farmers who use quad bikes. The new virtual reality experience is part of SafeWork NSW's $3.7 million Quad Bike Safety Improvement Program. (AAP VIDEO/Supplied/NSW Government)

A three-year-old boy is dead after a quad bike accident in northeast Victoria.

It occurred on a property at Deddick Valley, near the NSW border, at 10.30am on Sunday, police said.

The boy suffered severe injuries on the rural property, according to the Herald Sun.

He died at the scene and a report will be prepared for the coroner.
description: A three-year-old boy is dead after a quad bike accident in northeast Victoria.
